thread.title: Univision Stations Go Dark on Charter Communications in New York, LA, Other Big Markets | Variety
thread.title_full: Univision Stations Go Dark on Charter Communications in New York, LA, Other Big Markets | Variety

author: Cynthia Littleton
title: Univision Stations Go Dark on Charter Communications in New York, LA, Other Big Markets | Variety

organizations.name: univision stations go dark on charter communications

text:
Courtesy of Univision/Charter January 31, 2017 | 09:38PM PT 
Univision ’s O&O stations in New York, Los Angeles, Dallas and other big markets went dark on Charter Communications cable systems at midnight Tuesday, escalating a carriage dispute between the companies that has already sparked a lawsuit. 
Univision pulled its station signals from Charter systems after what it said was Charter’s failure to engage with “repeated, good-faith efforts to reach an agreement.” 
But Charter has maintained that it already has a long-term contract in force with Univision. The dispute stems from Charter’s acquisition last year of Time Warner Cable and Bright House Networks, which made it the nation’s second-largest cable operator behind Comcast Corp. Univision sued Charter last July in a dispute involving the post-merger contract terms. 
Charter could not immediately be reached for comment early Wednesday. 
More to come
